meanings.definition: In a literal manner or sense.
meanings.sent1: She read the instructions literately and followed them exactly.
meanings.sent2: He took her words literately and did exactly as she said.
meanings.sent3: The robot followed the directions literately, causing some unexpected results.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked literately, processing information like a computer.
meanings.sent5: The detective examined the crime scene literately, noticing every detail.

meanings.definition: With close adherence to the original text.
meanings.sent1: The translator worked literately to ensure the accuracy of the document.
meanings.sent2: She quoted the passage literately, without changing a single word.
meanings.sent3: The student copied the essay literately, hoping to impress the teacher.
meanings.sent4: Her memory stored the information literately, preserving it perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The artist recreated the painting literately, capturing every brushstroke.
